reauth_confirm.title: spotify Re-Authentication Required
reauth_confirm.description: The Spotify integration needs to re-authenticate with Spotify for account: {account}

abort.missing_configuration: The Spotify integration is not configured. Please follow the documentation.
abort.reauth_account_mismatch: Spotify account authenticated with does not match the account needing re-authentication for the spotify integration; please check the System Log for further information.
abort.invalid_access_token: OAuth access token is invalid for the spotify integration; please check the System Log for further information.
abort.oauth_error: OAuth error occurred while processing spotify OAuth Application Credentials; please check the System Log for further information.
abort.oauth_timeout: OAuth timeout error occurred while processing spotify OAuth Application Credentials.  This usually indicates a temporary condition; please check the System Log for further information.
abort.oauth_unauthorized: OAuth Application Credentials are unauthorized for use by the spotify integration; please check the System Log for further information.
abort.oauth_failed: OAuth request failed while processing spotify OAuth Application Credentials; please check the System Log for further information.
abort.setauthtoken_error: SpotifyClient authorization token could not be set from OAuth2 session token; please check the System Log for further information.

init.title: {name} Options
init.description: Configure spotify integration options that control functionality.

data.device_default: Default Spotify Connect Player Device ID when none are active.
data.device_loginid: Spotify Connect canonical loginid to use when connecting to an inactive device.
data.device_password: Spotify Connect password to use when connecting to an inactive device.
data.device_username: Spotify Connect username to use when connecting to an inactive device.
data.script_turn_on: Script called to turn on device that plays media content.
data.script_turn_off: Script called to turn off device that plays media content.
data.source_list_hide: The semi-colon delimited list of device names to hide in the source list.

error.no_player_devices: Per Spotify Web API, there are currently no Spotify Connect devices active.  Please close the configuration options, play a track on any Spotify Connect player for a minute or two, and then open the configuration options again.
error.device_password_required: Spotify Connect Device Password is required if a Spotify Connect Device Username was specified.
error.device_loginid_required: Spotify Connect Device LoginId is required if a Spotify Connect Device Username was specified.

removed_yaml.title: The Spotify YAML configuration has been removed
removed_yaml.description:
Configuring Spotify using YAML has been removed.

Your existing YAML configuration is not used by Home Assistant.

Remove the YAML configuration from your configuration.yaml file and restart Home Assistant to fix this issue.

add_player_queue_items.name: Add Player Queue Items
add_player_queue_items.description: Add one or more items to the end of the user's current Spotify Player playback queue.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

uris.name: URI's
uris.description: A list of Spotify track or episode URIs to add to the queue (spotify:track:6zd8T1PBe9JFHmuVnurdRp, spotify:track:1kWUud3vY5ij5r62zxpTRy); values can be track or episode URIs.  All URIs must be of the same type - you cannot mix and match tracks and episodes.  An unlimited number of items can be added in one request, but the more items the longer it will take.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The id or name of the Spotify Connect Player device this command is targeting.  If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.  If no device is active (or an '*' is specified), then the spotify default device is activated.

verify_device_id.name: Verify Device ID?
verify_device_id.description: True to verify a device id is active; otherwise, false to assume that a device id is already active. Default is True.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing the add request (if necessary). This delay will give the spotify web api time to process the change before another command is issued.  Default is 0.15; value range is 0 - 10.

check_album_favorites.name: Check Album Favorites
check_album_favorites.description: Check if one or more albums (or the currently playing album) exists in the current user's 'Your Library' favorites.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify album id's (e.g. `6vc9OTcyd3hyzabCmsdnwE,382ObEPsp2rxGrnsizN5TX`).  A maximum of 50 id's may be specified.  If omitted, the currently playing track album uri id value is used.

check_artists_following.name: Check Artists Following
check_artists_following.description: Check if one or more artists (or the currently playing artists) is followed in the current user's 'Your Library' favorites.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify artist id's (e.g. `2CIMQHirSU0MQqyYHq0eOx,1IQ2e1buppatiN1bxUVkrk`).  A maximum of 50 id's may be specified.  If omitted, the currently playing track artist uri id value is used.

check_audiobook_favorites.name: Check Audiobook Favorites
check_audiobook_favorites.description: Check if one or more audiobooks (or the currently playing audiobook) exists in the current user's 'Your Library' favorites.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify audiobook id's (e.g. `3PFyizE2tGCSRLusl2Qizf,7iHfbu1YPACw6oZPAFJtqe`).  A maximum of 50 id's may be specified.  If omitted, the currently playing audiobook uri id value is used.

check_episode_favorites.name: Check Episode Favorites
check_episode_favorites.description: Check if one or more episodes (or the currently playing episode) exists in the current user's 'Your Library' favorites.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify episode id's (e.g. `3F97boSWlXi8OzuhWClZHQ,1hPX5WJY6ja6yopgVPBqm4`).  A maximum of 50 id's may be specified.  If omitted, the currently playing episode uri id value is used.

check_playlist_followers.name: Check Playlist Followers
check_playlist_followers.description: Check to see if the current user is following a specified playlist.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

playlist_id.name: Playlist ID
playlist_id.description: The Spotify ID of the playlist (e.g. `3cEYpjA9oz9GiPac4AsH4n`).

user_ids.name: User ID's
user_ids.description: Deprecated - must contain the current user's Spotify Username; Maximum of 1 id.  Omit to default to current user name.

check_show_favorites.name: Check Show Favorites
check_show_favorites.description: Check if one or more shows (or the currently playing show) exists in the current user's 'Your Library' favorites.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify show id's (e.g. `6kAsbP8pxwaU2kPibKTuHE,4rOoJ6Egrf8K2IrywzwOMk`).  A maximum of 50 id's may be specified.  If omitted, the currently playing show uri id value is used.

check_track_favorites.name: Check Track Favorites
check_track_favorites.description: Check if one or more tracks (or the currently playing track) exists in the current user's 'Your Library' favorites.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify track id's (e.g. `1kWUud3vY5ij5r62zxpTRy,4eoYKv2kDwJS7gRGh5q6SK`).  A maximum of 50 id's may be specified.  If omitted, the currently playing context uri id value is used.

check_users_following.name: Check Users Following
check_users_following.description: Check to see if the current user is following one or more users.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify user ID's to check (e.g. `smedjan, 7piUznRWxNyKpaPvmOSdiZ`).  A maximum of 50 ID's can be specified.

follow_artists.name: Follow Artists
follow_artists.description: Add the current user as a follower of one or more artists.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify artist id's (e.g. `2CIMQHirSU0MQqyYHq0eOx,1IQ2e1buppatiN1bxUVkrk`).  A maximum of 50 id's may be specified.  If omitted, the currently playing track artist uri id value is used.

follow_playlist.name: Follow Playlist
follow_playlist.description: Add the current user as a follower of a playlist.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

playlist_id.name: ID's
playlist_id.description: The Spotify ID of the playlist (e.g. `3cEYpjA9oz9GiPac4AsH4n`).  If omitted, the currently playing playlist uri id value is used.

public.name: Public?
public.description: If true the playlist will be included in user's public playlists, if false it will remain private.

follow_users.name: Follow Users
follow_users.description: Add the current user as a follower of one or more users.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of the Spotify user IDs (e.g. 'smedjan,3758dfdsfjk435hjk6k79lm0n3c4').  A maximum of 50 IDs can be sent in one request.

get_album.name: Get Album
get_album.description: Get Spotify catalog information for a single album.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

album_id.name: Album Id
album_id.description: The Spotify ID of the album.  If omitted, the currently playing album uri id value is used.

market.name: Market / Country Code
market.description: An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. If a country code is specified, only content that is available in that market will be returned.  The country associated with the user account will take priority over this parameter.

get_album_favorites.name: Get Album Favorites
get_album_favorites.description: Get a list of the albums saved in the current Spotify user's 'Your Library'.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

limit.name: Limit
limit.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page of items when manual paging is used.  Default is 20, Range is 1 to 50.  See the limit_total argument for automatic paging option.

offset.name: Offset
offset.description: The page index offset of the first item to return.  Use with limit to get the next set of items.  Default is 0 (the first item).

market.name: Market / Country Code
market.description: An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. If a country code is specified, only content that is available in that market will be returned.  The country associated with the user account will take priority over this parameter.

limit_total.name: Limit Total
limit_total.description: The maximum number of items to return for the request.  If specified, this argument overrides the limit and offset argument values and paging is automatically used to retrieve all available items up to the specified limit total.

sort_result.name: Sort Result?
sort_result.description: True to sort result items by name prior to returning to the caller; otherwise, False to return results in the order that the Spotify Web API returned them.

For example `es_MX`, meaning `Spanish (Mexico)`.  Provide this parameter if you want the results returned in a particular language (where available).  Note that if locale is not supplied, or if the specified language is not available, all strings will be returned in the Spotify default language (American English).

verify_user_context.name: Verify User Context?
verify_user_context.description: If True, the active user context of the resolved device is checked to ensure it matches the Spotify Connect user context specified in the spotify configuration options.  If False, the user context will not be checked.  Default is True.

verify_timeout.name: Verify Timeout
verify_timeout.description: Maximum time to wait (in seconds) for the device to become active in the Spotify Connect device list.  This value is only used if a Connect command has to be issued to activate the device. Default is 5; value range is 0 - 10.

refresh_device_list.name: Refresh Device List?
refresh_device_list.description: True to refresh the Spotify Connect device list; otherwise, False to use the Spotify Connect device list cache.  Default is True.

activate_device.name: Activate Device?
activate_device.description: True to activate the device if necessary; otherwise, False.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing any command to the device.  This delay will give the spotify zeroconf api time to process the change before another command is issued.  Default is 0.25; value range is 0 - 10.

entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

verify_user_context.name: Verify User Context?
verify_user_context.description: If True, the active user context of the resolved device is checked to ensure it matches the specified Spotify Connect user context.  If False, the user context will not be checked.  Default is False.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing the final Connect command (if necessary). This delay will give the spotify web api time to process the device list change before another command is issued.  Default is 0.50; value range is 0 - 10.

player_media_pause.name: Player Media Pause
player_media_pause.description: Pause media play for the specified Spotify Connect device.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The id or name of the Spotify Connect Player device this command is targeting.  If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.  If no device is active (or an '*' is specified), then the spotify default device is activated.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing the final Connect command (if necessary). This delay will give the spotify web api time to process the device list change before another command is issued.  Default is 0.50; value range is 0 - 10.

player_media_play_context.name: Player Media Play Context
player_media_play_context.description: Start playing one or more tracks of the specified context on a Spotify Connect device.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

context_uri.name: Context Uri
context_uri.description: Spotify URI of the context to play (e.g. `spotify:album:6vc9OTcyd3hyzabCmsdnwE`).  Valid contexts are albums, artists & playlists.

offset_uri.name: Offset Uri
offset_uri.description: Indicates from what Uri in the context playback should start (e.g. `1kWUud3vY5ij5r62zxpTRy`.  Only available when contextUri corresponds to an artist, album or playlist.  The offsetPosition argument will be used if this value is null.

offset_position.name: Offset Position
offset_position.description: Indicates from what position in the context playback should start.  The value is zero-based, and can't be negative.  Only available when contextUri corresponds to an album or playlist.

position_ms.name: Seek Position
position_ms.description: The position (in milliseconds) to seek to; must be a positive number.  Passing in a position that is greater than the length of the track will cause the player to start playing the next track.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The id or name of the Spotify Connect Player device this command is targeting.  If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.  If no device is active (or an '*' is specified), then the spotify default device is activated.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing the final Connect command (if necessary). This delay will give the spotify web api time to process the device list change before another command is issued.  Default is 0.50; value range is 0 - 10.

player_media_play_track_favorites.name: Player Media Play Track Favorites
player_media_play_track_favorites.description: Start playing track favorites on the specified Spotify Connect device.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The id or name of the Spotify Connect Player device this command is targeting.  If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.  If no device is active (or an '*' is specified), then the spotify default device is activated.

shuffle.name: Shuffle?
shuffle.description: True to set player shuffle mode to on; otherwise, False for no shuffle.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing the command to the player.  This delay will give the spotify web api time to process the change before another command is issued.  Default is 0.50; value range is 0 - 10.

resolve_device_id.name: Resolve Device Id?
resolve_device_id.description: True to resolve the supplied `deviceId` value; otherwise, False not resolve the `deviceId` value as it has already been resolved.  Default is True.

limit_total.name: Limit Total
limit_total.description: The maximum number of items to retrieve from favorites.  Default is 200.

player_media_play_tracks.name: Player Media Play Tracks
player_media_play_tracks.description: Start playing one or more tracks on the specified Spotify Connect device.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

uris.name: Uri's
uris.description: A list of Spotify track URIs to play; can be track or episode URIs.  A maximum of 50 items can be added in one request.

position_ms.name: Seek Position
position_ms.description: The position (in milliseconds) to seek to; must be a positive number.  Passing in a position that is greater than the length of the track will cause the player to start playing the next track.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The id or name of the Spotify Connect Player device this command is targeting.  If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.  If no device is active (or an '*' is specified), then the spotify default device is activated.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing the final Connect command (if necessary). This delay will give the spotify web api time to process the device list change before another command is issued.  Default is 0.50; value range is 0 - 10.

player_media_resume.name: Player Media Resume
player_media_resume.description: Resume media play for the specified Spotify Connect device.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The id or name of the Spotify Connect Player device this command is targeting.  If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.  If no device is active (or an '*' is specified), then the spotify default device is activated.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing the final Connect command (if necessary). This delay will give the spotify web api time to process the device list change before another command is issued.  Default is 0.50; value range is 0 - 10.

player_media_seek.name: Player Media Seek
player_media_seek.description: Seeks to the given absolute or relative position in the user's currently playing track for the specified Spotify Connect device.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

position_ms.name: Absolute Seek Position
position_ms.description: The absolute position in milliseconds to seek to; must be a positive number or zero if the `relativePositionMS` argument is specified. Passing in a position that is greater than the length of the track will cause the player to start playing the next song. Example = `25000` to start playing at the 25 second mark.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The id or name of the Spotify Connect Player device this command is targeting.  If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.  If no device is active (or an '*' is specified), then the spotify default device is activated.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing the final Connect command (if necessary). This delay will give the spotify web api time to process the device list change before another command is issued.  Default is 0.50; value range is 0 - 10.

relative_position_ms.name: Relative Seek Position
relative_position_ms.description: The relative position in milliseconds to seek to; can be a positive or negative number, or zero if the `positionMS` argument is specified. Example = `-10000` to seek behind by 10 seconds; `10000` to seek ahead by 10 seconds.

player_media_skip_next.name: Player Media Skip Next
player_media_skip_next.description: Skips to next track in the user's queue for the specified Spotify Connect device.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The id or name of the Spotify Connect Player device this command is targeting.  If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.  If no device is active (or an '*' is specified), then the spotify default device is activated.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing the final Connect command (if necessary). This delay will give the spotify web api time to process the device list change before another command is issued.  Default is 0.50; value range is 0 - 10.

player_media_skip_previous.name: Player Media Skip Previous
player_media_skip_previous.description: Skips to previous track in the user's queue for the specified Spotify Connect device.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The id or name of the Spotify Connect Player device this command is targeting.  If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.  If no device is active (or an '*' is specified), then the spotify default device is activated.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing the final Connect command (if necessary). This delay will give the spotify web api time to process the device list change before another command is issued.  Default is 0.50; value range is 0 - 10.

player_resolve_device_id.name: Player Resolve Device ID
player_resolve_device_id.description: Resolves a Spotify Connect device identifier from a specified device id, name, alias id, or alias name.  This will ensure that the device id can be found on the network, as well as connect to the device if necessary with the current user context.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

device_value.name: Device Value
device_value.description: The device id (e.g. '0d1841b0976bae2a3a310dd74c0f337465899bc8') or name (e.g. 'Bose-ST10-1') value to resolve.

verify_user_context.name: Verify User Context?
verify_user_context.description: If True, the active user context of the resolved device is checked to ensure it matches the user context specified on the class constructor. If False, the user context will not be checked.  Default is True.

verify_timeout.name: Verify Timeout
verify_timeout.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing the final Connect command (if necessary). This delay will give the spotify web api time to process the device list change before another command is issued.  Default is 5.0; value range is 0 - 10.

player_set_repeat_mode.name: Player Set Repeat Mode
player_set_repeat_mode.description: Set repeat mode for the specified Spotify Connect device.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

state.name: State
state.description: The repeat mode state to set; `track` will repeat the current track; `context` will repeat the current context; `off` will turn repeat off.  Default is 'off'.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The id or name of the Spotify Connect Player device this command is targeting.  If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.  If no device is active (or an '*' is specified), then the spotify default device is activated.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing the command to the player.  This delay will give the spotify web api time to process the change before another command is issued.  Default is 0.50; value range is 0 - 10.

player_set_shuffle_mode.name: Player Set Shuffle Mode
player_set_shuffle_mode.description: Set shuffle mode for the specified Spotify Connect device.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

state.name: Shuffle State?
state.description: True to set player shuffle mode to on; otherwise, False for no shuffle.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The id or name of the Spotify Connect Player device this command is targeting.  If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.  If no device is active (or an '*' is specified), then the spotify default device is activated.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing the command to the player.  This delay will give the spotify web api time to process the change before another command is issued.  Default is 0.50; value range is 0 - 10.

player_set_volume_level.name: Player Set Volume Level
player_set_volume_level.description: Set volume level for the specified Spotify Connect device.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

volume_level.name: Volume Level
volume_level.description: The volume level to set, expressed as a percentage value (e.g. 25).  Must be a value from 0 (muted) to 100 (max volume) inclusive.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The id or name of the Spotify Connect Player device this command is targeting.  If not supplied, the user's currently active device is the target.  If no device is active (or an '*' is specified), then the spotify default device is activated.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing the command to the player.  This delay will give the spotify web api time to process the change before another command is issued.  Default is 0.50; value range is 0 - 10.

player_transfer_playback.name: Player Transfer Playback
player_transfer_playback.description: Transfer playback to a new Spotify Connect device and optionally begin playback.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

device_id.name: Device ID
device_id.description: The id or name of the Spotify Connect Player device on which playback should be started/transferred.  If no device is specified, then the spotify default device is activated.

play.name: Start Play?
play.description: True (default) to start playback on the new device; otherise, False to keep the current playback state on the existing device.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing the final Connect command (if necessary). This delay will give the spotify web api time to process the device list change before another command is issued.  Default is 0.50; value range is 0 - 10.

refresh_device_list.name: Refresh Device List?
refresh_device_list.description: True to refresh the Spotify Connect device list; otherwise, False to use the Spotify Connect device list cache.  Default is True.

force_activate_device.name: Force Activate Device?
force_activate_device.description: True to issue a Spotify Connect Disconnect call prior to transfer, which will force the device to reconnect to Spotify Connect; otherwise, False to not disconnect. Default is True.

playlist_cover_image_add.name: Playlist Cover Image Add
playlist_cover_image_add.description: Replace the image used to represent a specific playlist.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

playlist_id.name: Playlist ID
playlist_id.description: The Spotify ID of the playlist (e.g. 5AC9ZXA7nJ7oGWO911FuDG).

image_path.name: Image Path
image_path.description: The fully-qualified path of the image to be uploaded (e.g. `www/images/spotify_playlist_default_image.png`).  The image must be in PNG or JPEG format, and cannot exceed 256KB in Base64 encoded size.

playlist_change.name: Playlist Change
playlist_change.description: Change a playlist's details (name, description, and public / private state).

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

playlist_id.name: Playlist ID
playlist_id.description: The Spotify ID of the playlist (e.g. `5AC9ZXA7nJ7oGWO911FuDG`).

name.name: Name
name.description: The updated name of the playlist (e.g. `My Updated Playlist`).  This name does not need to be unique; a user may have several playlists with the same name.

description.name: Description
description.description: The playlist description, as displayed in Spotify Clients and in the Web API.

public.name: Public?
public.description: If true, the playlist will be public; if false, it will be private.

collaborative.name: Collaborative?
collaborative.description: If true, the playlist will be collaborative (other users can modify it).  To create a collaborative playlist you must also set the public argument to false.

image_path.name: Image Path
image_path.description: The fully-qualified path of the image to be uploaded (e.g. `www/images/spotify_playlist_default_image.png`).  The image must be in PNG or JPEG format, and cannot exceed 256KB in Base64 encoded size.  Omit this parameter if you do not wish to update the existing playlist image.

playlist_create.name: Playlist Create
playlist_create.description: Create an empty playlist for a Spotify user.  The playlist will remain empty until you add tracks.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

user_id.name: User ID
user_id.description: The user's Spotify user ID (e.g. 32k99y2kg5lnn3mxhtmd2bpdkjfu).  Omit this argument to use the Spotify User ID of the player entity_id.

name.name: Name
name.description: The name for the new playlist (e.g. `My New Playlist`).  This name does not need to be unique; a user may have several playlists with the same name.

description.name: Description
description.description: The playlist description, as displayed in Spotify Clients and in the Web API.

public.name: Public?
public.description: If true, the playlist will be public; if false, it will be private.

collaborative.name: Collaborative?
collaborative.description: If true, the playlist will be collaborative (other users can modify it).  To create a collaborative playlist you must also set the public argument to false.

image_path.name: Image Path
image_path.description: The fully-qualified path of the image to be uploaded (e.g. `www/images/spotify_playlist_default_image.png`).  The image must be in PNG or JPEG format, and cannot exceed 256KB in Base64 encoded size.  Omit this parameter if you do not wish to add a playlist image.

playlist_items_add.name: Playlist Items Add
playlist_items_add.description: Add one or more items to a user's playlist.  Items are added in the order they are listed in the `uris` argument.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

playlist_id.name: Playlist ID
playlist_id.description: The Spotify ID of the playlist (e.g. 5AC9ZXA7nJ7oGWO911FuDG).

uris.name: URI's
uris.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify URIs to add; can be track or episode URIs (e.g. spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh).  A maximum of 100 items can be specified in one request.  If nothing is specified, then the track (or episode) uri currently playing is used.

position.name: Position
position.description: The position to insert the items, a zero-based index.  For example, to insert the items in the first position use a value of 0; to insert the items in the third position use a value of 2.  Omit the parameter to append the items to the end of the playlist.

playlist_items_clear.name: Playlist Items Clear
playlist_items_clear.description: Removes (clears) all items from a user's playlist.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

playlist_id.name: Playlist ID
playlist_id.description: The Spotify ID of the playlist (e.g. 5AC9ZXA7nJ7oGWO911FuDG).

playlist_items_remove.name: Playlist Items Remove
playlist_items_remove.description: Remove one or more items from a user's playlist.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

playlist_id.name: Playlist ID
playlist_id.description: The Spotify ID of the playlist (e.g. 5AC9ZXA7nJ7oGWO911FuDG).

uris.name: URI's
uris.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify URIs to remove; can be track or episode URIs (e.g. spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh).  A maximum of 100 items can be specified in one request.  If nothing is specified, then the track (or episode) uri currently playing is used.

snapshot_id.name: Snapshot ID
snapshot_id.description: The playlist's snapshot ID against which you want to make the changes (e.g. `MzgsMWVkNDY3MTQ5YjVjYWE0MzAyNjkyZWMyOThjNjE3YWMwOTY0ZmJjYg==`).  The API will validate that the specified items exist and make the changes, even if more recent changes have been made to the playlist.  If omitted, the current playlist is updated.

playlist_items_reorder.name: Playlist Items Reorder
playlist_items_reorder.description: Reorder items in a user's playlist.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

playlist_id.name: Playlist ID
playlist_id.description: The Spotify ID of the playlist (e.g. 5AC9ZXA7nJ7oGWO911FuDG).

range_start.name: Range Start
range_start.description: The position of the first item to be reordered.  This is a one-offset integer (NOT zero-offset).

insert_before.name: Insert Before
insert_before.description: The position where the items should be inserted.  To reorder the items to the end of the playlist, simply set `insertBefore` to the position after the last item.  This is a one-offset integer (NOT zero-offset).

range_length.name: Range Length
range_length.description: The amount of items to be reordered; defaults to 1 if not set.  The range of items to be reordered begins from the `rangeStart` position, and includes the `rangeLength` subsequent items.

snapshot_id.name: Snapshot ID
snapshot_id.description: The playlist's snapshot ID against which you want to make the changes (e.g. `MzgsMWVkNDY3MTQ5YjVjYWE0MzAyNjkyZWMyOThjNjE3YWMwOTY0ZmJjYg==`).  The API will validate that the specified items exist and make the changes, even if more recent changes have been made to the playlist.  If omitted, the current playlist is updated.

playlist_items_replace.name: Playlist Items Replace
playlist_items_replace.description: Replace one or more items in a user's playlist. Replacing items in a playlist will overwrite its existing items. This service can also be used to clear a playlist.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

playlist_id.name: Playlist ID
playlist_id.description: The Spotify ID of the playlist (e.g. `3cEYpjA9oz9GiPac4AsH4n`).

uris.name: URI's
uris.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify URIs to replace; can be track or episode URIs (e.g. `spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh, spotify:episode:26c0zVyOv1lzfYpBXdh1zC`). A maximum of 100 items can be specified in one request.

remove_album_favorites.name: Remove Album Favorites
remove_album_favorites.description: Remove one or more albums from the current user's 'Your Library'.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify album id's (e.g. `6vc9OTcyd3hyzabCmsdnwE,382ObEPsp2rxGrnsizN5TX`).  A maximum of 50 id's may be specified.  If omitted, the currently playing track album uri id value is used.

remove_audiobook_favorites.name: Remove Audiobook Favorites
remove_audiobook_favorites.description: Remove one or more audiobooks from the current user's 'Your Library'.

entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify episode id's (e.g. `3F97boSWlXi8OzuhWClZHQ,1hPX5WJY6ja6yopgVPBqm4`).  A maximum of 50 id's may be specified.  If omitted, the currently playing episode uri id value is used.

remove_show_favorites.name: Remove Show Favorites
remove_show_favorites.description: Remove one or more albums from the current user's 'Your Library'.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify show id's (e.g. `6kAsbP8pxwaU2kPibKTuHE,4rOoJ6Egrf8K2IrywzwOMk`).  A maximum of 50 id's may be specified.  If omitted, the currently playing show uri id value is used.

remove_track_favorites.name: Remove Track Favorites
remove_track_favorites.description: Remove one or more tracks from the current user's 'Your Library'.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify track id's (e.g. `1kWUud3vY5ij5r62zxpTRy,4eoYKv2kDwJS7gRGh5q6SK`).  A maximum of 50 id's may be specified.  If omitted, the currently playing context uri id value is used.

entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify audiobook id's (e.g. `3PFyizE2tGCSRLusl2Qizf,7iHfbu1YPACw6oZPAFJtqe`).  A maximum of 50 id's may be specified.  If omitted, the currently playing audiobook uri id value is used.

save_episode_favorites.name: Save Episode Favorites
save_episode_favorites.description: Save one or more episodes to the current user's 'Your Library'.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify episode id's (e.g. `3F97boSWlXi8OzuhWClZHQ,1hPX5WJY6ja6yopgVPBqm4`).  A maximum of 50 id's may be specified.  If omitted, the currently playing episode uri id value is used.

save_show_favorites.name: Save Show Favorites
save_show_favorites.description: Save one or more shows to the current user's 'Your Library'.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify show id's (e.g. `6kAsbP8pxwaU2kPibKTuHE,4rOoJ6Egrf8K2IrywzwOMk`).  A maximum of 50 id's may be specified.  If omitted, the currently playing show uri id value is used.

save_track_favorites.name: Save Track Favorites
save_track_favorites.description: Save one or more tracks to the current user's 'Your Library'.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

ids.name: ID's
ids.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify track id's (e.g. `1kWUud3vY5ij5r62zxpTRy,4eoYKv2kDwJS7gRGh5q6SK`).  A maximum of 50 id's may be specified.  If omitted, the currently playing context uri id value is used.

search_albums.name: Search Albums
search_albums.description: Get Spotify catalog information about Albums that match a keyword string.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify Web API.

limit.name: Limit
limit.description: The maximum number of items to return in a page of items when manual paging is used.  Default is 20, Range is 1 to 50.  See the limit_total argument for automatic paging option.

offset.name: Offset
offset.description: The page index offset of the first item to return.  Use with limit to get the next set of items.  Default is 0 (the first item).

market.name: Market / Country Code
market.description: An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code. If a country code is specified, only content that is available in that market will be returned.  The country associated with the Spotify user account will take priority over this parameter.

include_external.name: Include External
include_external.description: If 'audio' is specified it signals that the client can play externally hosted audio content, and marks the content as playable in the response. By default externally hosted audio content is marked as unplayable in the response.  Allowed values are 'audio'.

limit_total.name: Limit Total
limit_total.description: The maximum number of items to return for the request.  If specified, this argument overrides the limit and offset argument values and paging is automatically used to retrieve all available items up to the specified limit total.

zeroconf_device_connect.name: ZeroConf Device Connect
zeroconf_device_connect.description: Calls the `addUser` Spotify Zeroconf API endpoint to issue a call to SpConnectionLoginBlob.  If successful, the associated device id is added to the Spotify Connect active device list for the specified user account.  This will also issue a `resetUsers` call prior to the `addUser` call.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify ZeroConf API service.

host_ipv4_address.name: Device IPV4 Address
host_ipv4_address.description: IPV4 address at which the Spotify Connect Zeroconf API can be reached on the Spotify Connect device (e.g. '192.168.1.81').

host_ip_port.name: Device IP Port
host_ip_port.description: Port number at which the Spotify Connect Zeroconf API can be reached on the Spotify Connect device (e.g. 8200).

cpath.name: CPath Identifier
cpath.description: Spotify Connect Zeroconf API CPath property value (e.g. '/zc').

version.name: Version Indicator
version.description: Spotify Connect Zeroconf API version number that the device supports (e.g. '1.0').

use_ssl.name: Use SSL?
use_ssl.description: True if the host device utilizes HTTPS Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) support; otherwise, False to utilize HTTP.  Default is False (HTTP).

username.name: Spotify User Name
username.description: Spotify user name to login with (e.g. 'yourusername@mail.com').  This MUST match the account name (or one of them) that was used to configure Spotify Connect on the manufacturer device. If not specified, the integration options Spotify Connect username value will be used.

password.name: Spotify Password
password.description: Spotify Connect user password to login with. If not specified, the integration options Spotify Connect password value will be used.

loginid.name: Spotify Login ID
loginid.description: Spotify Connect login id to login with (e.g. '31l77fd87g8h9j00k89f07jf87ge').  This is also known as the canonical user id value.  This MUST be the value that relates to the `username` argument. If not specified, the integration options Spotify Connect loginId value will be used.

pre_disconnect.name: Pre Disconnect?
pre_disconnect.description: True if a Disconnect should be made prior to the Connect call.  This will ensure that the active user is logged out, which must be done if switching user accounts; otherwise, False to not issue a Disconnect call.  Default is False.

verify_device_list_entry.name: Verify Device List Entry?
verify_device_list_entry.description: True to ensure that the device id is present in the Spotify Connect device list before issuing a call to Connect; Connect will not be called if the device id is already in the list; otherwise, False to always call Connect to add the device.  Default is False.

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing a command to the device. This delay will give the spotify zeroconf api time to process the change before another command is issued. Default is 0.50; value range is 0 - 10.

zeroconf_device_disconnect.name: ZeroConf Device Disconnect
zeroconf_device_disconnect.description: Calls the `resetUsers` Spotify Zeroconf API endpoint to issue a call to SpConnectionLogout. The currently logged in user (if any) will be logged out of Spotify Connect, and the device id removed from the active Spotify Connect device list.

entity_id.name: Entity ID
entity_id.description: Entity ID of the spotify device that will make the request to the Spotify ZeroConf API service.

host_ipv4_address.name: Device IPV4 Address
host_ipv4_address.description: IPV4 address at which the Spotify Connect Zeroconf API can be reached on the Spotify Connect device (e.g. '192.168.1.81').

host_ip_port.name: Device IP Port
host_ip_port.description: Port number at which the Spotify Connect Zeroconf API can be reached on the Spotify Connect device (e.g. 8200).

cpath.name: CPath Identifier
cpath.description: Spotify Connect Zeroconf API CPath property value (e.g. '/zc').

version.name: Version Indicator
version.description: Spotify Connect Zeroconf API version number that the device supports (e.g. '1.0').

use_ssl.name: Use SSL?
use_ssl.description: True if the host device utilizes HTTPS Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) support; otherwise, False to utilize HTTP.  Default is False (HTTP).

delay.name: Delay
delay.description: Time delay (in seconds) to wait AFTER issuing a command to the device. This delay will give the spotify zeroconf api time to process the change before another command is issued. Default is 0.50; value range is 0 - 10.
